Your Work Shapes the World

Whether it be groundbreaking products, best in class solutions or creating a lifelong career, you can do the work that matters at Caterpillar. With a 95-year legacy of quality and innovation and 150 locations in countries around the world, your impact spans the globe.

When you join Caterpillar, you are joining a team of makers, innovators and doers. We are the people who roll up our sleeves and do the work to build a better world. As a Transportation Analyst /Data Analyst - Transportation & Logistics , you will be developing breakthrough Analytics Insights (in Power BI) by combining business acumen with... in-depth data understanding. You will also be the main link between business users and data engineers.

The insights generated will be used by the broader Transportation team and the factories (Finance, Supply Chain Managers, Material Planners, Purchasing Managers, ....) in their quest for answers to business related questions. • Creation of Power BI dashboards, including distribution to the end users and support in usage/consumption,
• Translating business requirements into technical requirements for development of the data pipeline,
• Maintenance and ownership of the application landscape (data models, dashboards, business applications, ...),
• Identification of business and data process improvements to generate new insights, in close collaboration with business users,
• Usage of data analytics to identify potential savings, data inconsistencies,
• Automation of processes leveraging tools of the Power Platform (Power Automate, Power BI, Power Apps and Power Virtual Agents),
• Design, apply and demonstrate data and analytics best practices and standard processes within the organization,
• Coaching of less experienced team members.

Required Qualifications:
• Master level degree (in Computer Science or other disciplines, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Applications, Statistics, ...) from a college or university, or equal qualification in experience,
• 3-5 years of experience in a data analytics/business intelligence role,
• Ability to independently drive project,
• Advanced knowledge of Power BI (Desktop + Service),
• Advanced knowledge in programming (SQL, Python),
• Experience with end-to-end ETL processes, design, languages and tools (Oracle, Snowflake, Alteryx, ...),
• knowledge of tools within Power Platform, mainly Power Automate and Power Apps.

Desired Qualifications:
• Any background in / previous exposure to one or more of the following areas of expertise will be a plus: Transportation / Finance / Purchasing / Material Planning,
• Experience with Operational Excellence, Six Sigma and Lean methodologies.

The ideal candidate should:
• Have excellent written and verbal communication in English, and the ability to work with all levels within the organization (management, customers, IT Department)
• Have deep interest in technology, data analysis and supply chain
• Have an analytical mindset with an eye for problem solving and continuous improvement
• Be able to lead business conversations, and translate business requirements into technical requirements
• Think outside the box
• Work against strict deadlines
• Have strong interpersonal skills and adopt a collaborative work style.

Additional Information

Work location: Sosnowiec , Poland

Our goal at Caterpillar is for you to have a rewarding career. Our teams are critical to the success of our customers who build a better world.

Here you earn more than just a monthly salary because we value your performance. We offer a total rewards package based on your yearly performance rating and corporate results.

We offer:

• social system

The Power of Everyone

At Caterpillar, we believe each person is unique and valued, and are committed to ensuring that our workplace is diverse and representative of the many customers we serve around the globe. Different perspectives help us achieve our best work and come together to form a high-performing Caterpillar team that makes positive changes in the communities where we live and work.

Learn about Caterpillar at www.caterpillar.com

title: Data Governance Analyst

HSBC Service Delivery (Polska) Sp. z o.o. is a part of HSBC Holdings plc, the parent company of the HSBC Group, headquartered in London. The Group serves customers worldwide from over 6,300 offices in over 75 countries and territories in Europe, Asia, North and Latin America, and the Middle East and North Africa. HSBC is one of the world’s largest banking and financial services organizations. Currently, we are looking for a candidate for the position of:

Data Governance Analyst (ORR)

The role resides in the Risk and Compliance Regulatory Programmes Data Team which reports into Risk and Compliance Data and Reporting Services and ultimately in R&C COO.

This role is focused on the remediation activities for BCBS239, which is The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision issued the BCBS239 principles for effective risk data aggregation and reporting. In response, HSBC issued a BCBS239 Compliance Framework. It consists of a set of principles - overall governance of reporting, risk data... aggregation capabilities, risk reporting practices, management reviews.

The role will oversee the implementation, Reporting & Data support and attestation of the BCBS 239 remediation and enhancements in particular for the Risk Types.

• Assist in building the Design Utility supporting Reporting and Data effort and Attestation processes artefacts and controls.
• Face off to the DAO Utility in regard to enhancement or correct implementation of DAO process.
• Build and refine the artefacts required to manage the refreshed DAO Controls.
• Build and implement the artefacts for the Program Governance and Change Control Process.
• Development of inputs and KPIs in our dashboards to show progress against the plans and scope.
• Stakeholder management within the allocated function across the functions and business.
• Establish and build the roadmap for Challenge and Assurance/evidencing compliance.

Requirements:
• Knowledge of BCBS 239.
• Knowledge of data governance.

• Open personality with effective communication skills.

title: Corporate Finance - Financial Analysis - Data Product Go-to-Market...
description:
Job Description

The Data Domains Team within Financial Analysis (FA) is working to build scalable, end-to-end data products that enable centralized, self-service data sourcing through an array of consumption patterns optimized for Planning and Analysis (P&A) functions.

About the job:

The Data Product Go-to-Market team runs the Onboarding and Customer Success activities for the data products we provide to our customers. They design and execute the business processes for data domain governance, data usage compliance, data quality and readiness. The team engages directly with data customers to enable them to succeed using the data platform by providing training and assistance. The successful candidate will take ownership of day-to-day project delivery, as well as maintain relationships across multiple levels of the firm.

The team is tasked with defining the processes and executing them by coordinating with senior management and stakeholders across FA, Corporate Technology, and LoBs... The Team partners with Corporate Technology, Product Managers and the Data Modeling team to ensure quality delivery of solutions by leveraging an Agile software development lifecycle (SDLC).

Why join?

This is a fascinating time in our industry. By now, it™s a cliché that Banks will have to embrace technology and innovation if they are to thrive in the years to come. We are already bought into this and are committed to show that we can do it and are looking for others to join. You will:
• Work on some of the most complex problems imaginable at the intersection of two dynamic industries: finance and technology
• Interact with wide range of stakeholders across the bank
• Deliver products that can change the way our stakeholders operate
• Interface directly with data customers to enable them to access the new data platform and use it to successfully drive business value
• Influence decisions on platform strategy, client engagement and implementing innovative technology-based solutions at the bank
• Partner with other high-performing teams within JPM to inspire innovation and champion change throughout the bank

What are we looking for?
• Driving Customer Success: Partner with peers and product managers across Finance, with Technology counterparts, and with data consumers to design and execute business processes that enable consumers to access the data that supports their analysis and decision making.
• Delivering Data: Oversee data onboarding and delivery to ensure they are aligned to controls and governance policies, as well as client requirements and ensure data quality.
• Communicating Effectively: Commercial mindset with excellent communication skills, assertiveness and ability to navigate a matrix organization.
• Reporting Status: Provide on-time and accurate reporting, as well as ongoing updates to all project team members and notify all stakeholders on data readiness and quality.

We are looking for a product manager with experience in working in a matrixed organization to build the next generation of digital products and services on our Digital Platform.
• MS/MBA degree or equivalent experience
• 3+ years™ experience in the Product Management / Transformation discipline delivering data products, market/user research, project management and working with clients to extract whatever is necessary to get a solid understanding of what needs to be built
• Experience with Finance & Business Management data, processes and functions, including budgeting, forecasting, actuals processing, allocations, and all related execution tracking
• Experienced working in a product-centric culture driven by an organized process of product decision making; ability to create impactful and commercial products and advocate these Product Management principles with all types of audiences
• Able to review/analyze existing data strategy and consumption processes and recommend improvements
• Highly motivated and eager to roll up your sleeves to make things happen
